txt.en:
'A skilled hunter should be able to find his way through any terrain, [placeholder], to show his fellowship to their destination with all speed. When you know the fastest path through the wild, you can better keep your friends from danger.

'I have heard that Horace Roxhythe, a hunter who makes his home in Ost Forod, has come to the Ranger-camp on the island of Tinnudir, in Evendim. If you speak with him, he may be willing to teach you of the best paths through Evendim.

'Be warned, though, that he will expect proof of your skills as a hunter before he teaches you anything.'

'A skilled hunter should be able to find his way through any terrain, [placeholder], to show his fellowship to their destination with all speed. When you know the fastest path through the wild, you can better keep your friends from danger.

'I have heard that Horace Roxhythe, a hunter who makes his home in Ost Forod, has come to the Ranger-camp on the island of Tinnudir, in Evendim. If you speak with him, he may be willing to teach you of the best paths through Evendim.

'Be warned, though, that he will expect proof of your skills as a hunter before he teaches you anything.'
Hunter: Tracks Through Evendim

'A skilled hunter should be able to find his way through any terrain, [placeholder], to show his fellowship to their destination with all speed. When you know the fastest path through the wild, you can better keep your friends from danger.

'I have heard that Horace Roxhythe, a hunter who makes his home in Ost Forod, has come to the Ranger-camp on the island of Tinnudir, in Evendim. If you speak with him, he may be willing to teach you of the best paths through Evendim.

'Be warned, though, that he will expect proof of your skills as a hunter before he teaches you anything.'

'A skilled hunter should be able to find his way through any terrain, [placeholder], to show his fellowship to their destination with all speed. When you know the fastest path through the wild, you can better keep your friends from danger.

'I have heard that Horace Roxhythe, a hunter who makes his home in Ost Forod, has come to the Ranger-camp on the island of Tinnudir, in Evendim. If you speak with him, he may be willing to teach you of the best paths through Evendim.

'Be warned, though, that he will expect proof of your skills as a hunter before he teaches you anything.'
'I crossed to the mainland by bridge, but from there you will need to pick up my trail, if you are to find the arrow-head I have hidden somewhere in Evendim.'

'Welcome to Tinnudir, [placeholder]. I can show you secret paths by which you can lead your fellowship here quickly, but you must prove to me that you are worthy to be taught such skills. You must know for what to look.

'I have hidden one of my arrow-heads somewhere in Evendim. If you can pick up my trail and follow the signs, you will be able to recover the arrow-head and prove to me that you are ready. If not, well...perhaps another hunter will succeed where you fail.

'I will tell you this: I crossed the bridge from Tinnudir to the mainland. So you will want to begin your search for my trail there.'

'A skilled hunter should be able to find his way through any terrain, [placeholder], to show his fellowship to their destination with all speed. When you know the fastest path through the wild, you can better keep your friends from danger.

'Horace Roxhythe, a hunter who makes his home in Ost Forod, has come to this camp. If you speak with him, he may be willing to teach you of the best paths through Evendim.

'Be warned, though, that he will expect proof of your skills as a hunter before he teaches you anything.'
'Horace Roxhythe has come to the Ranger-camp on the island of Tinnudir, in Evendim, and can teach you much of the ways of the wild.'

'A skilled hunter should be able to find his way through any terrain, [placeholder], to show his fellowship to their destination with all speed. When you know the fastest path through the wild, you can better keep your friends from danger.

'I have heard that Horace Roxhythe, a hunter who makes his home in Ost Forod, has come to the Ranger-camp on the island of Tinnudir, in Evendim. If you speak with him, he may be willing to teach you of the best paths through Evendim.

'Be warned, though, that he will expect proof of your skills as a hunter before he teaches you anything.'

Horace Roxhythe is at the Ranger-camp on the island of Tinnudir, in Evendim.\n\nYou have been told to speak with Horace Roxhythe, a skilled hunter who can teach you the secrets of finding your way throughout Evendim.
'Horace Roxhythe has come to the Ranger-camp on the island of Tinnudir, in Evendim, and can teach you much of the ways of the wild.'

'A skilled hunter should be able to find his way through any terrain, [placeholder], to show his fellowship to their destination with all speed. When you know the fastest path through the wild, you can better keep your friends from danger.

'I have heard that Horace Roxhythe, a hunter who makes his home in Ost Forod, has come to the Ranger-camp on the island of Tinnudir, in Evendim. If you speak with him, he may be willing to teach you of the best paths through Evendim.

'Be warned, though, that he will expect proof of your skills as a hunter before he teaches you anything.'

Horace Roxhythe hid one of his arrow-heads somewhere in Evendim. He crossed from the island of Tinnudir to the mainland on the stone bridge.\n\nYou have been challenged to follow Horace's trail and recover the arrow-head he hid somewhere in Evendim to prove you are ready for his teachings.
'Horace Roxhythe has come to the Ranger-camp on the island of Tinnudir, in Evendim, and can teach you much of the ways of the wild.'

'A skilled hunter should be able to find his way through any terrain, [placeholder], to show his fellowship to their destination with all speed. When you know the fastest path through the wild, you can better keep your friends from danger.

'I have heard that Horace Roxhythe, a hunter who makes his home in Ost Forod, has come to the Ranger-camp on the island of Tinnudir, in Evendim. If you speak with him, he may be willing to teach you of the best paths through Evendim.

'Be warned, though, that he will expect proof of your skills as a hunter before he teaches you anything.'
Horace Roxhythe is at the Ranger-camp on the island of Tinnudir.\n\nYou have found the arrow-head that Horace hid in Evendim and should return it to him so he will recognize your skill as a hunter.
'Horace Roxhythe has come to the Ranger-camp on the island of Tinnudir, in Evendim, and can teach you much of the ways of the wild.'
'Horace Roxhythe has come to the Ranger-camp on the island of Tinnudir, in Evendim, and can teach you much of the ways of the wild.'
'Horace Roxhythe has come to the Ranger-camp here and can teach you much of the ways of the wild.'
'Horace Roxhythe has come to the Ranger-camp on the island of Tinnudir, in Evendim, and can teach you much of the ways of the wild.'

'Horace Roxhythe has come to the Ranger-camp on the island of Tinnudir, in Evendim, and can teach you much of the ways of the wild.'
'Horace Roxhythe has come to the Ranger-camp on the island of Tinnudir, in Evendim, and can teach you much of the ways of the wild.'
'Evendim can appear peaceful, but do not be fooled!'
Find scratched arrow-head
'You have my greetings, [placeholder]!'
Bring scratched arrow-head to Horace Roxhythe

'A skilled hunter should be able to find his way through any terrain, [placeholder], to show his fellowship to their destination with all speed. When you know the fastest path through the wild, you can better keep your friends from danger.

'I have heard that Horace Roxhythe, a hunter who makes his home in Ost Forod, has come to the Ranger-camp on the island of Tinnudir, in Evendim. If you speak with him, he may be willing to teach you of the best paths through Evendim.

'Be warned, though, that he will expect proof of your skills as a hunter before he teaches you anything.'
There are tracks here in the soil, but you cannot tell what made them, or how long ago they were made. It is not likely that Horace came this way.
The trail here is muddled and confused. That Horace came this way is unmistakeable to your skilled eye, but you cannot discern in what direction he left this place.
Peering closely at the soil, you find a scratched arrow-head partially embedded in the dirt. This must be Horace's arrow-head.
The marks in the dirt leave no question: the trail here leads south-east.
There is little question to your keen eye that Horace's trail here bends south-west.

'Welcome to Tinnudir, [placeholder]. I can show you secret paths by which you can lead your fellowship here quickly, but you must prove to me that you are worthy to be taught such skills. You must know for what to look.

'I have hidden one of my arrow-heads somewhere in Evendim. If you can pick up my trail and follow the signs, you will be able to recover the arrow-head and prove to me that you are ready. If not, well...perhaps another hunter will succeed where you fail.

'I will tell you this: I crossed the bridge from Tinnudir to the mainland. So you will want to begin your search for my trail there.'

'Yes, this is my arrow-head! See these scratches here? I carved my initials there so I would be able to recognize it. A number of burglars have tried to pass themselves off as hunters, and I needed some way to catch imitations.\n\n'I will teach you secret paths through Evendim, [placeholder], so you will be able to lead your fellowship to Tinnudir with utmost speed.'
You have been encouraged to learn the lay of the lands around Lake Nenuial, so you may better find your way around its shores.
'You have not recovered my arrow-head, [placeholder]? Are you certain you are a hunter?'

'A skilled hunter should be able to find his way through any terrain, [placeholder], to show his fellowship to their destination with all speed. When you know the fastest path through the wild, you can better keep your friends from danger.

'I have heard that Horace Roxhythe, a hunter who makes his home in Ost Forod, has come to the Ranger-camp on the island of Tinnudir, in Evendim. If you speak with him, he may be willing to teach you of the best paths through Evendim.

'Be warned, though, that he will expect proof of your skills as a hunter before he teaches you anything.'
